reviewText: There are so many great memories attached the Johnny Maestro and The Brooklyn Bridge that this was a "must" purchase. The memories live on.

reviewText: Johnny Maestro may have gray hair, but his voice is just as crystal clear and beautiful as ever.  This was a most enjoyable show, first class all the way.  I will enjoy it over and over.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Some voices mellow through the years and assume a timber which belies the ravages of time. So it is with Johnny and the Bridge. Sounding in great voice, the boys re-visit many of their tunes from days passed by and make you glad that they did. With inter-spaced interviews between songs, the concert speaks for itself as it glides through the musical years on a sled of glass. If you enjoyed them then, you will enjoy them now. A must buy for fans who have been running the course for years, and those who are just joining in. A great concert by an ongoing class act.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sad Johnny Maestro is gone but this cd was pure entertainment to watch with the family.The vocals and band were all excellent on this and original members from Crests & Brooklyn Bridge together and the strength of Johnny's vocals is a testament to so many great singers out of the 50's/60's and the music we had then that had REAL meaning and true artistic depth nothing like the garbage put out today that disappears in a week or so from peoples' minds.This cd and music and all of the music from that period STILL lives on after all these years for one reason- it was great music and the performers then were ONLY about "making the best meaning in a song" instead of today's mentality "how much money can we make".
Title: N/A

reviewText: From the very first time I heard the marvelous voice of Johnny Maestro, I became a solid fan. Sure, this concert would definitely have benefitted from 5.1 sound, and other amenities, but the voice of Johnny Maestro, and the solid backup of the Brooklyn Bridge (and the excellent two singers from the former Del Satins), carried this DVD into the Must-Have category. Get it, crank up the sound, sit back and put your feet on the coffee table, and enjoy the heck out of this excellent performance.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The shame of a too early death of one of the best vocalists ever.  Had to buy this DVD video after having been a long time fan and seeing Johnny Maestro and the Brooklyn Bridge live.  So badly wanted to see him again.  This is the only video I know that exists of him performing and it is a must have for any fan.  I watched it on a 42 inch high def TV and the video is crystal clear.  can't wait to play it through my surround system and crank up the volume on those wonderful vocals.  Any fan of Johnny should have this in their collection.  You won't be sorry.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When Johnny Maestro passed away in March 2010,the world lost one of the greatest voices of the rock and roll era! This concert from 2005 showcases his great talent! He and The Bridge were in really great form on this night and the audience reaction showed just how much he and his music are loved! I loved the interviews,but would have prefered them to be separate from the concert,but I am not making a big deal out of that. If you are a fan of Johnny Maestro and The Brooklyn Bridge,this dvd should be in your library-it will bring back great memories and keep both Johnny and Fred Ferrara alive forever!
summary: Excellent concert-great way to remember Johnny Maestro!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an excellent concert..If you remember the fifties with a wonderful group called the Crests..This dvd is for you.What great music.they played..Johnny maestro and the crests,became the brooklyn bridge...Members from both groups became one...The sound. the music,were beautifully performed with great style..The brooklyn bridge are,top notch,spirited,and motivated..This is how i would describe,.the brooklyn bridge....Some groups go thru the motions,but this group is hip alive,and really gave the audience,what they wanted and more...I think you noticed,that i love the music...yes this is an excellent dvd...5 star rated...Good music for all ages.thank you stewart L.
summary: An excellent concert.The brooklyn bridge,really rock.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Out of all the 50's & early 60's Rock & Rollers, Johnny Maestro has remained the one singer who sounds exactly the same as he did back then.  It's hard to believe but if you close your eyes, you can't tell it's a 21st Century concert.  The BB harmonies are right on as well.  The only complaint, and why I did not give this 5 stars, is the interviews that pop up between songs.  It would have been nice to see the concert with no interruptions.  But, by all means, get this.  You won't be disappointed.

reviewText: Every song on this dvd is excellent.  I am 61 and this music is great to listen too and even better on dvd when you can see who is singing the songs.  I loved this dvd.
summary: BROOKLYN BRIDGE AND THE CRESTS LEAD SINGER
